name: Avoid using cookie without the HttpOnly flag
associatedValueName: Call stack from the "setHttpOnly" call to the "addCookie" target
description: This rule will check in the source code if cookies are configured with the 'HttpOnly' attribute, and if the value is set to true.
output: List all methods full name that add cookie to a response object without setting the 'HttpOnly' attribute to true
rationale: When the attribute 'HttpOnly' is set to true, the session cookie cannot be read by the client-side script, and so, limit XSS vulnerabilities.
reference:
CWE-1004: Sensitive Cookie Without 'HttpOnly' Flag
https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/1004.html

OWASP Top Ten 2021 Category A05:2021 - Security Misconfiguration
https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/1349.html
remediation: Always set the HttpOnly attribute to true.
total: Number of methods adding a cookie
alternativeName: Ensure you have set the HttpOnly flag for cookies

technicalCriteria.name: PCI-DSS4-Requirement-6.2.4 - Software engineering techniques or other methods are defined and in use by software development personnel to prevent or mitigate common software attacks and related vulnerabilities

qualityStandards.name: Software engineering techniques or other methods are defined and in use by software development personnel to prevent or mitigate common software attacks and related vulnerabilities
The application must set the HTTPOnly flag on session cookies.
